Literature Review: Prosodic prominence is a crucial aspect of human communication, referring to the way in which words and phrases are emphasized in speech. The concept of prosodic prominence has been extensively studied across languages, with recent findings highlighting significant differences between languages. This literature review aims to provide an overview of the current state of research on prosodic prominence, its definition, and its relationship to other phonological and prosodic phenomena.
